name: donut

procedures: T1027.002::[Donut] can generate packed code modules.
T1027::[Donut] can generate encrypted, compressed/encoded, or otherwise obfuscated code modules.
T1055::[Donut] includes a subproject DonutTest to inject shellcode into a target process.
T1057::[Donut] includes subprojects that enumerate and identify information about [Process Injection] candidates.
T1059.001::[Donut] can generate shellcode outputs that execute via PowerShell.
T1059.005::[Donut] can generate shellcode outputs that execute via VBScript.
T1059.006::[Donut] can generate shellcode outputs that execute via Python.
T1059.007::[Donut] can generate shellcode outputs that execute via JavaScript or JScript.
T1059::[Donut] can generate shellcode outputs that execute via Ruby.
T1070::[Donut] can erase file references to payloads in-memory after being reflectively loaded and executed.
T1071.001::[Donut] can use HTTP to download previously staged shellcode payloads.
T1105::[Donut] can download and execute previously staged shellcode payloads.
T1106::[Donut] code modules use various API functions to load and inject code.
T1562.001::[Donut] can patch Antimalware Scan Interface (AMSI), Windows Lockdown Policy (WLDP), as well as exit-related [Native API] functions to avoid process termination.
T1620::[Donut] can generate code modules that enable in-memory execution of VBScript, JScript, EXE, DLL, and dotNET payloads.

description: [Donut](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0695) is an open source framework used to generate position-independent shellcode.(Citation: Donut Github)(Citation: Introducing Donut) [Donut](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0695) generated code has been used by multiple threat actors to inject and load malicious payloads into memory.(Citation: NCC Group WastedLocker June 2020)
